org.tms.api

Interface InitializableTableProperties

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IndexableTableElements
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Table, TableContext

    public interface InitializableTableProperties
extends IndexableTableElements
    This interface defines the methods that are common to TableContext and Table instances, each of which have several TablePropertys that can be initialized automatically from a template instance when creating new TableContexts and Tables. When these methods are invoked on TableContexts, they get and set the values for all initializable TablePropertys, and establish the initial values that new Tables will have when created with that TableContext as a parent.

    When invoked on a specific Table, they get and set the values for that specific Table.

    Since:
    "1.0"
    Version:
    "1.1"

    • Method Detail

      • isAutoRecalculate

        boolean isAutoRecalculate()
        Returns true if derived table elements (see Derivation) are automatically recalculated in response to changes to dependent table cells.
        Returns:
        true if derived elements are automatically recalculated when dependent cells are modified

      • setAutoRecalculate

        void setAutoRecalculate(boolean autoRecalculate)
        Set to true to allow derived elements to automatically recalculate when dependent cells are modified. Set to false to inhibit this behavior, which can be useful if you are about to make several changes to table elements, all of which would trigger derivations to recalculate. Call the Table.recalculate() method to manually recalculate all derived elements in a table.
        Parameters:
        autoRecalculate - true if derived elements should automatically recalculate when dependent cells are modified
        Throws:
        DeletedElementException - if this table has been deleted

      • getRowCapacityIncr

        int getRowCapacityIncr()
        Returns the row capacity increment for this table. When new Rows are added to a table, room for the new row plus the row capacity increment are allocated at the same time to make subsequent row additions more efficient. The default row capacity increment is .
        Returns:
        the row capacity increment

      • setRowCapacityIncr

        void setRowCapacityIncr(int increment)
        Sets the row capacity increment for this table. This value is used to minimize memory fragmentation by Table implementations that use List data structures.

        The default row capacity increment is .

        Parameters:
        increment - the new row capacity increment

      • getColumnCapacityIncr

        int getColumnCapacityIncr()
        Returns the column capacity increment for this table. When new Columns are added to a table, room for the new column plus the column capacity increment are allocated at the same time to make subsequent column additions more efficient. The default column capacity increment is .
        Returns:
        the column capacity increment

      • setColumnCapacityIncr

        void setColumnCapacityIncr(int increment)
        Sets the column capacity increment for this table. This value is used to minimize memory fragmentation by Table implementations that use List data structures.

        The default column capacity increment is .

        Parameters:
        increment - the new column capacity increment
